misdeed: A string of unsettling incidents has befallen the men of a small village.  They wake with a start in the dead of night, their hearts pounding, their bodies slick with sweat, and their minds filled with images of a terrifying, shadowy figure.
solution: The Vaesen is a Mare and can be defeated by someone loudly declaring her a Mare at the moment she transforms back into a human.

clues.description: The victims all complain of feeling suffocated, as if a weight pressed down on their chest while they slept.
The attacks seem to coincide with the full moon, waning as the lunar cycle progresses.
Some men report seeing a fleeting glimpse of a beautiful woman with long, dark hair just before waking in terror.
The local wise woman discovers traces of an unknown herb in the victims' bedrooms, one said to induce vivid dreams and sleep paralysis.
The village horses are found in a state of agitation, their manes tangled, their eyes wide with terror.
A recently unearthed grave is discovered to be empty, the coffin containing only a shroud and a lock of long, black hair.

plotTwist.description: A young widow, driven mad by grief and loneliness, unknowingly embodies the Vaesen, her sorrow and longing manifesting as a terrifying, nocturnal predator.
